算法博弈论 三篇不同方向的论文阅读

Iannis 给了三篇论文，三个方向。分别通读一下这三篇论文，看看什么主题比较感兴趣吧。

Possible Project Topics of Algorithmic Game Theory

Algorithmic Game Theory

Mechanism Design ✅

  • Auction Theory
  • Market Design
  • …

The first paper is about Mechanism Design for Machine Learning/Statistical Tasks.

简单来讲就是说，将提供训练集的个体视为智能体 Agent，在训练人工智能模型的时候，这些智能体有动机操纵提供的训练集数据来使得人工智能模型最终的输出有利于该智能体。而研究者的任务是研究如何设计一个机制来鼓励智能体提供真实的数据（no incentive to misreport）

  • Mean Estimation (2016 ICML)
  • Classification
  • Regression (Current)

Mechanism Design for Machine Learning

Strategyproof Linear Regression in High Dimensions by Chen et al, ACM Economics and Computation 2018

Strategyproof

说人话：就是占优策略激励相容 (Dominant Strategy Incentive Compatible abbr. DSIC)，向机制诚实报告就是最优策略 dominant strategy

Abstract

Strategyproof mechanisms on Linear regression

Agents: single-peaked preferences

Ham Sandwich Theorem

This paper proposed: Generalized Resistant Hyperplane mechanisms.

Introduction

Motivation: Designing a Machine Learning algorithm that is robust to noise in training data

Adversarial noise: sabotaging the algorithm.

这一点有印象，本科期间了解过，在图像上有策略的增加一些肉眼很难分辨的对抗噪点就能欺骗视觉模型使得图像分类的结果出错。

Training data: provided by agents

Aligning the agents’ incentives correctly → possible to obtain uncontaminated data

Scenario

Linear Regression i.e., fitting a hyperplane through given data.

Agents’ incentive: to minimize their vertical distance from the output hyperplane.

Design: Strategyproof regression mechanisms without payments.

Proposed Model

Fitting a hyperplane through data points (xi,yi)(\mathbb x_i,y_i)(xi​,yi​) for xi∈Rd;yi∈R;i=1,⋯ ,n\mathbb x_i\in\mathbb R^d;y_i\in\mathbb R;i=1,\cdots,nxi​∈Rd;yi​∈R;i=1,⋯,n.

yiy_iyi​ is held only by agent iii.

xi\mathbb x_ixi​ is independent variables, public information.

Mechanism: elicits the private information of the agents, returns a hyperplane represented by vector β=(β1,β0)∈Rd+1\beta=(\beta_1,\beta_0)\in\mathbb R^{d+1}β=(β1​,β0​)∈Rd+1.

Residual for agent iii: ri=yi−β1Txi−β0r_i=y_i-\beta_1^T\mathbb x_i-\beta_0ri​=yi​−β1T​xi​−β0​

Agents wish to minimize ∣ri∣|r_i|∣ri​∣

Dekel et al: empirical risk minimization with L1L_1L1​ loss (L1L_1L1​-ERM) coupled with specific tie-breaking rule is group strategyproof.

No coalition of agents can be weakly better off by misreporting.

This paper: replacing the L1L_1L1​ loss by a weighted L1L_1L1​ loss and adding convex regularization to the risk function preserves group strategyproof.

Perote et al: 2-dimensional case, propose a wide family of strategyproof mechanisms, clockwise repeated median (CRM).

But this paper prove that it’s wrong, giving 3 stricter conditions. CRM mechanism coincide with resistant line mechanisms

Main Result

Generalizing CRM family to higher dimensions.

Introduce the family of generalized resistant hyperplane (GRH).

In d+1d+1d+1 dimensions, GRH parametrized by d+1d+1d+1 subset of agents.

Impartiality: group strategyproof.

比 DSIC 更严苛：如果智能体相互之间串通，谎报都不能使得收益增加。

Another desideratum except strategyproof: Good statistical efficiency.

Important: this paper establish a lower bound of 222 on the approximation ratio of any strategyproof mechanism, which means that any mechanism that is even close to ordinary least squares regression must be manipulable.

Related Work

Research: 3 categories:

  1. Manipulable information

    Most papers assume: independent variables (feature vectors) - public; Dependent variables (labels) - private.

    • Strategyproof classifiers / agents interest in a shared set of input points.

    • Constructing classifiers robust to agents strategically misreporting feature vector.

      One-shot Stackelberg game

  2. Goal of the agents ✅ (Exact one this paper discusses)

    • Motivated by privacy concerns: Tradeoff between accuracy and privacy

    • Agent want model make accurate assessment on their own sample, even if this reduce overall accuracy.

  3. Use of payments and incentive guarantees

    • Monetary payment?

    • How strongly to guarantee truthful reporting

      stronger strategyproofness VS. Bayes-Nash incentive compatibility.

Model

(Omit Notation here)

Strategyproofness: Every single agent has no incentive to misreport its true value.

Group Strategyproofness: Stronger than strategyproofness. No coalition of agents can simultaneously misreport in a way that: no agent in the coalition is strictly worse off and some agent in the coalition is strictly better off (with no regards to other agents’ report value)

This paper does not consider weaker group strategyproofness, as mechanism proposed is able to satisfy stronger one.

Families of Strategyproof Mechanisms

Empirical Risk Minimization with the L1L_1L1​ Loss

When dimension d=0d=0d=0 i.e., xi=xj(∀i,j∈N)\mathbb x_i=\mathbb x_j(\forall i,j\in N)xi​=xj​(∀i,j∈N). Choosing the median of the reported values achieves group strategyproofness.

Median minimize L1L_1L1​ loss: arg⁡min⁡y∈R∑i=1n∣y−yi∣\arg\min_{y\in\mathbb R}\sum_{i=1}^n|y-y_i|argminy∈R​∑i=1n​∣y−yi​∣.

This can be generalized into higher dimension while maintaining group strategy proof (Dekel et al)

This paper proposes Generalized L1L_1L1​-ERM, which is also group strategyproof.

Weighted L1L_1L1​ loss, the loss of each agent iii is multiplied by a weight wixw_i^{\mathbb x}wix​.

adding a convex regularizer h:F→Rh:\mathcal F\rarr Rh:F→R

Advantage of Generalized L1L_1L1​-ERM:

  1. Eliminating tie-breaking step if risk function guaranteed to have a unique minimizer (To achieve this by adding strictly convex regularizer).
  2. It covers all generalized medians while L1L_1L1​-ERM reduces to a specific mechanism.

quantile regression mechanisms

R^q(f,D)=∑yi≥f(xi)q⋅∣yi−f(xi)∣+∑yi<f(xi)(1−q)⋅∣yi−f(xi)∣\hat R_q(f,\mathcal D)=\sum_{y_i\ge f(\mathbb x_i)}q\cdot|y_i-f(\mathbb x_i)|+\sum_{y_i\lt f(\mathbb x_i)}(1-q)\cdot|y_i-f(\mathbb x_i)|R^q​(f,D)=yi​≥f(xi​)∑​q⋅∣yi​−f(xi​)∣+yi​<f(xi​)∑​(1−q)⋅∣yi​−f(xi​)∣

Not remain strategyproof in higher dimension.

Generalized Resistant Hyperplane Mechanisms

Extending family of resistant line mechanisms.

Clockwise Repeated Median Mechanisms

Perote et al.

Only defined for the special case of simple linear regression.

Need to assume that set of points is admissible

Admissible set is a collection of data points D=(xi,yi)i∈N\mathcal D=(x_i,y_i)_{i\in N}D=(xi​,yi​)i∈N​ that xi≠xj∀i,j∈Nx_i\neq x_j\forall i,j\in Nxi​=xj​∀i,j∈N

Step:

  1. Divide agent into two subsets S,S′S,S'S,S′.
  2. Compute the median clockwise angle (CWA)
  3. For each point in SSS, choose i∗∈Si^*\in Si∗∈S whose median CWA is the median of median CWAs from all points in SSS.
  4. If median CWA from i∗i^*i∗ is towards point j∗∈S′j^*\in S'j∗∈S′, the mechanism returns the straight line passing through points i∗i^*i∗ and j∗j^*j∗.

CWA

From (xi,yi)(x_i,y_i)(xi​,yi​) to (xj,yj)(x_j,y_j)(xj​,yj​), CWA is

CWA((xi,yi),(xj,yj))=π+sign(xj−xi)⋅π2+sign(yj−yixj−xi)∣arctan⁡(yj−yixj−xi)∣sign(x)={−1,x<00,x=01,x>0\text{CWA}((x_i,y_i),(x_j,y_j))=\pi+\text{sign}(x_j-x_i)\cdot\frac{\pi}{2}+\text{sign}(\frac{y_j-y_i}{x_j-x_i})|\arctan(\frac{y_j-y_i}{x_j-x_i})|\\ \text{sign}(x)=\begin{cases} -1,x\lt0\\ 0,x=0\\ 1,x\gt0 \end{cases}CWA((xi​,yi​),(xj​,yj​))=π+sign(xj​−xi​)⋅2π​+sign(xj​−xi​yj​−yi​​)∣arctan(xj​−xi​yj​−yi​​)∣sign(x)=⎩⎪⎪⎨⎪⎪⎧​−1,x<00,x=01,x>0​

Directing angle

DA(S,S′)=medi∈Smedj∈S′:j≠iCWA((xi,yi),(xj,yj))\text{DA}(S,S')=\text{med}_{i\in S}\text{med}_{j\in S':j\neq i}\text{CWA}((x_i,y_i),(x_j,y_j))DA(S,S′)=medi∈S​medj∈S′:j=i​CWA((xi​,yi​),(xj​,yj​))

Mechanism returns the line β=(β1,β0)\beta=(\beta_1,\beta_0)β=(β1​,β0​) s.t.

β1=tan⁡[DA(S,S′)−π−π2⋅sign(DA(S,S′)−π)]β0=medi∈S(yi−β⋅xi)\beta_1=\tan[\text{DA}(S,S')-\pi-\frac{\pi}{2}\cdot\text{sign}(\text{DA}(S,S')-\pi)]\\ \beta_0=\text{med}_{i\in S}(y_i-\beta\cdot x_i)β1​=tan[DA(S,S′)−π−2π​⋅sign(DA(S,S′)−π)]β0​=medi∈S​(yi​−β⋅xi​)

But this paper provides two counterexamples showing that (S,S′)(S,S')(S,S′)-CRM mechanisms (under Perote’s loose restrict) violate strategyproofness.

This paper looks for a subset of the CRM mechanisms to establish group strategyproofness. (impose more restrictive conditions)

Separable Sets of Point in a Plane

In this paper definition is two sets can be separated by a vertical line.

(S,S′)(S,S')(S,S′)-CRM is group strategyproof if one of the following conditions holds

  1. S=S′S=S'S=S′.
  2. SSS and S′S'S′ are separable.
  3. S∩S′=∅S\cap S'=\emptyS∩S′=∅ and min⁡(∣S∣,∣S′∣)=1\min(|S|,|S'|)=1min(∣S∣,∣S′∣)=1. (dictatorship)

Generalized Resistant Line Mechanisms on a Plane

This paper introduces a novel family of group strategyproof mechanisms.

Start from: Resistant Line mechanisms

3 separable subset L,M,RL,M,RL,M,R. A line β\betaβ given by

medi∈Lyi−β1xi−β0=medi∈Ryi−β1xi−β0=0\text{med}_{i\in L}y_i-\beta_1x_i-\beta_0=\text{med}_{i\in R}y_i-\beta_1x_i-\beta_0=0medi∈L​yi​−β1​xi​−β0​=medi∈R​yi​−β1​xi​−β0​=0

Making median of residuals in LLL and RRR zero.

Yielding (L,R)(L,R)(L,R)-CRM mechanism

β1=medi∈Lmedj∈Ryj−yixj−xiβ0=medi∈Lyi−β1xi=medj∈Ryj−β1xj\beta_1=\text{med}_{i\in L}\text{med}_{j\in R}\frac{y_j-y_i}{x_j-x_i}\\ \beta_0=\text{med}_{i\in L}y_i-\beta_1x_i=\text{med}_{j\in R}y_j-\beta_1x_jβ1​=medi∈L​medj∈R​xj​−xi​yj​−yi​​β0​=medi∈L​yi​−β1​xi​=medj∈R​yj​−β1​xj​

Brown-Mood mechanism: LLL and RRR are two half, MMM is empty.

Tukey mechanism: L,M,RL,M,RL,M,R each contains 131\over331​ points.

This paper: instead of making the median residuals from SSS and S′S'S′ zero, making the k-th smallest residual in SSS and k′k'k′-th smallest residual in S′S'S′ zero, for fixed k∈[∣S∣]k\in[|S|]k∈[∣S∣] and k′∈[∣S′∣]k'\in[|S'|]k′∈[∣S′∣].

Generalized Resistant Line Mechanisms (GRL)

min⁡i∈Skyi−β1xi−β0=min⁡j∈S′k′yj−β1xj−β0=0\min_{i\in S}^ky_i-\beta_1x_i-\beta_0=\min_{j\in S'}^{k'} y_j-\beta_1x_j-\beta_0=0i∈Smink​yi​−β1​xi​−β0​=j∈S′mink′​yj​−β1​xj​−β0​=0

Theorem: (S,S′,k,k′)(S,S',k,k')(S,S′,k,k′)-generalized resistant line mechanism is group strategyproof.

Noted: GRL is a generalized resistant mechanism version of (S,S′)(S,S')(S,S′)-CRM mechanism.

Generalized Resistant Hyperplane Mechanisms in High Dimensions

In d+1d+1d+1 dimension, take d+1d+1d+1 separable subsets of data points. Return regression hyperplane with makes prescribed percentiles of residuals in each set zero.

How to generalize to higher dimension? Using Ham Sandwich Theorem.

A ddd-dimension hyperplane HHH can “bisect” a d+1d+1d+1 hyperspace.

Well separable aka affinely independent sets

Given t∈[k+1]t\in[k+1]t∈[k+1], finite sets S1,⋯ ,StS_1,\cdots,S_tS1​,⋯,St​ of points in Rk\mathbb R^kRk are called well separable if for all disjoint I,J⊆[t]I,J\subseteq[t]I,J⊆[t], there exists a hyperplane HHH s.t. Si⊂H+╲HS_i\sub H^+\diagdown HSi​⊂H+╲H for each i∈Ii\in Ii∈I and Sj⊂H−╲HS_j\sub H^-\diagdown HSj​⊂H−╲H for each j∈Jj\in Jj∈J, i.e. HHH separates ∪i∈ISi\cup_{i\in I}S_i∪i∈I​Si​ from ∪j∈JSj\cup_{j\in J}S_j∪j∈J​Sj​ by putting them in different open half-spaces.
